AEMO at the Heart of Energy 

AEMO is Australia’s independent energy system and market operator and system planner. AEMO’s purpose is to ensure safe, reliable and affordable energy today, and enable the energy transition for the benefit of all Australians.  Australian governments are now committed to a net zero economy for Australia by 2050 and our vision is to enable this. We have the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to co-design the future of our energy systems, and our core values revolve around character, commitment, and connection. Join us as we contribute to this significant transition in the energy sector.    

About the role  

 The Operational DER Management team, within AEMO Operations, is responsible for integration of distributed energy resources (DER) into AEMO’s operational and technical functions. With more than half the National Electricity Market now supplied by DER in some periods, Australia is leading the world in integration of distributed PV, and our team’s goal is to make sure the necessary measures are in place to be able to securely, safely and efficiently operate the power system with up to 100% of energy supplied by renewable distributed resources in the next few years. We are passionate about our work, and seeking a collaborative, innovative, and hard-working individual to join us. 

In this role, you will conduct detailed dispatch modelling to analyse system security risks arising in Minimum System Load periods, and develop the methodologies required to integrate DER into AEMO’s operational processes.  You will be working with a team to support AEMO’s control room in the development of procedures for managing periods with very high levels of distributed resources operating. 

Reporting to the Manager – Operational DER Management (within Systems Capability, Operations), your role can be based at any of our office locations across multiples states. 

This is an 18-month fixed term contract.

 What you will be doing

Dispatch modelling to understand security risks arising in Minimum System Load (MSL) periods.

Develop novel methodologies and approaches to predict MSL periods in AEMO’s scheduling processes.

Input to the development of control room tools and procedures for managing MSL periods.

Collaborate and liaise with other AEMO teams and external stakeholders.

What you will bring to the role  

Tertiary qualification in electrical engineering, data science, computer science, software development or similar.

Quantitative analysis skills, including problem solving, modelling, and critical thinking.

A detailed understanding of NEM dispatch processes, including Frequency Control Ancillary Services and the NEM Dispatch Engine (NEMDE)

Flexible working: work from home, part time, job share, hybrid options, and additional leave options 

Professional development via projects, industry networks, job rotation, study assistance and more. 

Give back with up to 4 days of volunteering leave per year.

Did you know?

The mission of the Australian Federal Police is to provide dynamic and effective law enforcement to the people of Australia. It provides policing throughout Australia in relation to the prevention and detection of crimes against the Commonwealth, its laws and integrity, and community police services to the Community of the ACT.

Working for the AFP provides you with a diverse and rewarding career. Whether you immerse yourself in a position on the frontline, or provide critical operational or professional support, the work you do makes a big impact on the people of Australia. 

We recognise your contribution to our workforce and offer generous remuneration and conditions including:

Six weeks (30 days) of paid annual leave per year + additional paid Christmas stand down 
4 extra days of mandatory rest leave per year 
18 days of paid personal leave per year
Generous superannuation of 15.4%
18 weeks paid Parental Leave for Primary Caregiver (and 11 weeks for Secondary Caregiver) + additional unpaid leave entitlements for up until 24 months from the child’s date of birth or placement
Generous salaries and incremental salary progression governed by the AFP Enterprise Agreement 
Flexible and hybrid working arrangement that provides work/life balance
Health & wellbeing services – with a focus on early intervention, education and prevention
Access to ongoing training and professional development opportunities 

What is the role?

Applications are sought from suitably qualified applicants wishing to be considered for a Data Scientist role in the Data Capability Development (DCD) team for Electronic Surveillance Integration (ESI).

ESI develops and operates a wide range of lawful covert surveillance capabilities in support of the AFP’s operational requirements. ESI capabilities are developed both in-house and sourced from commercial vendors. Our in-house electronic surveillance expertise is much sought-after by domestic and international law enforcement and intelligence partners, with the AFP having an enviable reputation for our bespoke collection capabilities.

As a Technical Specialist in the AFP you will ensure the achievement of outcomes are in accordance with the regulatory framework, the AFP Code of Conduct and the AFP Governance Instruments. It is expected that the successful applicant will deliver on the core responsibilities and meet any requirements of the position as outlined below.

Technical Specialists provide expert consultancy within their area of expertise to develop and promote technical solutions which support the business requirements of the AFP. A Technical Specialist role does not hold any leadership or financial delegations.

For more information about working in Electronic Surveillance Integration, part of Digital Surveillance Collection, please visit https://dscjobs.afp.gov.au

What will you do?

As a data scientist, your responsibilities will include:

Exploratory analysis of complex datasets to support investigative processes and the development of data capabilities across ESI.
Research and development of machine learning models combining methods from statistics, spatiotemporal analysis, deep learning, graph data science, natural language processing, computer vision, etc, that support AFP’s mission.
Collaboration with the data engineering and infrastructure teams to implement solutions at scale.
Collaboration with industry, academia and other government agencies to develop bespoke data science solutions to law enforcement challenges.
Mentoring junior team members in data science and/or specialized data analytics.
Maintaining currency in subject matter expertise through ongoing professional development and learning opportunities outside the formal education process.

Essential Requirements

Tertiary qualification or demonstrated experience in related field, such as science, technology, engineering, mathematics, or a similar technical field.
Demonstrated strong problem-solving skills in data science, statistics and machine learning.
Demonstrated experience in the development and implementation of data science / machine learning solutions in a business context.
Strong interpersonal skills, including stakeholder management.
Strong communication skills, including the ability to present complex topics and solutions to all audiences, technical and non-technical.
A Negative Vetting 2 (Top Secret) security clearance or the ability to obtain one – this will be sponsored by the AFP for successful candidates.

At TSF Level 2, in addition to above:

Postgraduate qualifications or equivalent experience in data science and/or machine learning.
Demonstrated experience managing the whole data science / machine learning project life cycle from a technical perspective.

Desirable Requirements

While not essential, your application will stand out if you have experience in various of the following areas:

Experience with various programming languages, query languages and APIs.
Experience working in a Linux/Windows environment.
Working with Agile methodologies (e.g. Kanban, Scrum).
Experience in geospatial analysis, natural language processing, signal processing and/or computer vision.
Sound knowledge and experience working with APIs, AI/ML workflow frameworks and corresponding microservices.
Prior experience with Intelligence, Defence of Law Enforcement.

Additional Information

This position is a AFP Technical Specialist Band 1 - 2
When applying you will be asked to nominate your preferred band level, however final determination of the band level you are found suitable for is at the discretion of the panel.
This role is located in Canberra and applicants are expected to be based in Canberra. Any relocation to Canberra will be at the applicant's own cost.

Job Description

At Canva, our mission is to empower the world to design. To ensure our generative AI models are truly helpful, we are seeking a talented Research Engineer to build the foundational datasets and systems that fuel our next-generation generative AI models and evaluation capabilities.

About the role:

In this foundational role, you will be the expert on what truly fuels our models: data. You'll own the end-to-end lifecycle of our critical datasets, from curating nuanced human feedback on design quality to pioneering machine learning for high-quality synthetic data generation. This unique position calls for a data-first thinker with a strong design sensibility, passionate about building the high-quality ground truth at scale that will define the future of creativity by ensuring our models align with human taste and intent.

At the moment, this role is focused on:

Statistical Analysis & Insights: Applying robust statistical methodologies to analyze data, identify significant trends, and derive actionable insights. This includes hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and determining statistical significance to validate model performance and user preferences.

Human Feedback Data Curation: Owning the design, processing, cleaning, and strategic curation of large-scale, subjective human feedback on design quality, which is the lifeblood of our models.

Synthetic Data Generation: Using generative AI and machine learning techniques to create novel, high-quality synthetic data that augments our training sets and improves model capabilities.

Alignment Analysis & Evaluation Design: Designing methods to analyze outputs from both human and automated systems to deeply understand and measure our models' alignment with user preferences.

Primary Responsibilities:
